Self.Wiki: Determines the hitbox and damage parameters for attacks.

disableParam_NT.Wiki: Exclude from the NT version or mark the ones to be excluded.

disableParam_Product.Wiki: Exclude from the product version or mark the items to be excluded.

hit0_Radius.Wiki: Determines the radius of the hitbox (sphere/capsule).

hit1_Radius.Wiki: Determines the radius of the hitbox (sphere/capsule).

hit2_Radius.Wiki: Determines the radius of the hitbox (sphere/capsule).

hit3_Radius.Wiki: Determines the radius of the hitbox (sphere/capsule).

knockbackMPS.Wiki: Determines the distance the victim is knocked back by. In metres per second.

hitStopTime.Wiki: The duration that the victim's animations are paused for when hit. In seconds.

spEffectId0.Wiki: SpEffect ID applied to victim by this attack.

spEffectId1.Wiki: SpEffect ID applied to victim by this attack.

spEffectId2.Wiki: SpEffect ID applied to victim by this attack.

spEffectId3.Wiki: SpEffect ID applied to victim by this attack.

spEffectId4.Wiki: SpEffect ID applied to victim by this attack.

hit0_DmyPoly1.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tip of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit1_DmyPoly1.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tip of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit2_DmyPoly1.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tip of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit3_DmyPoly1.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tip of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit0_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tail of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit1_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tail of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit2_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tail of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

hit3_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The dummy polygon ID to place the sphere hitbox, or the tail of the capsule hitbox, for this hit.

blowingCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base blow-off value.

atkPhysCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base Kinetic attack value.

atkMagCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base Energy attack value.

atkFireCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base Explosive attack value.

atkThunCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base Coral attack value.

atkStamCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base stamina attack value.

guardAtkRateCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base guard attack value. Compared against the guard defense value to determine if the attack will bounce.

guardBreakCorrection.Wiki: Player only. The multiplier to the base guard defense value. Compared against the guard attack value to determine if the attack will bounce.

atkThrowEscapeCorrection.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the base throw attack value.

atkSuperArmorCorrection.Wiki: Player only. The multiplier to apply to the base poise attack value.

atkPhys.Wiki: The base Kinetic attack value. Used primarily for NPC attacks.

atkMag.Wiki: The base Energy attack value. Used primarily for NPC attacks.

atkFire.Wiki: The base Explosive attack value. Used primarily for NPC attacks.

atkThun.Wiki: The base Coral attack value. Used primarily for NPC attacks.

guardAtkRate.Wiki: The base guard attack value. Compared against the guard defense value to determine if the attack will bounce.

guardBreakRate.Wiki: The base guard defense value. Compared against the guard attack value to determine if the attack will bounce.

atkObj.Wiki: The base object destruction value. Applied to the object's HP.

guardStaminaCutRate.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the reduction of stamina damage when guarding. Positive values increase guard stability, negative values decrease it.

guardRate.Wiki: The multiplier to apply to the guard absorption value from the weapon. 0, 1x / 100, 2x / -100, guard multiplier = (guard multiplier / 100) to increase / decrease the parameter to 0. + 1)

throwTypeId.Wiki: The throw type ID to use with this attack against the victim.

hit0_hitType.Wiki: The hit collision type for this hit slot.

hit1_hitType.Wiki: The hit collision type for this hit slot.

hit2_hitType.Wiki: The hit collision type for this hit slot.

hit3_hitType.Wiki: The hit collision type for this hit slot.

hti0_Priority.Wiki: The priority for this hit slot. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti1_Priority.Wiki: The priority for this hit slot. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti2_Priority.Wiki: The priority for this hit slot. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti3_Priority.Wiki: The priority for this hit slot. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

dmgLevel.Wiki: The damage animation to apply to the victim of this attack.

mapHitType.Wiki: Which map do you see around the attack? The set

guardCutCancelRate.Wiki: Guard cut rate invalidation ratio (-100 to 100) Normal at 0 / Completely invalidated at -100 / Doubles the defense effect of the opponent at 100 -50, 100% cut shield becomes 50% cut Become

atkAttribute.Wiki: Live bullet attribute to set for attack

spAttribute.Wiki: Special attributes to set for attacks

atkType.Wiki: Specify particles and sounds at the time of attack (1 set by attribute, material, size)

atkMaterial.Wiki: Specify particles and sounds at the time of attack (1 set by attribute, material, size)

atkSize.Wiki: Specify particles and sounds at the time of attack (Although it is reserved, it is used, so be sure to set it blank or small)

defSeMaterial1.Wiki: The sounds to use when guarding against this attack.

hitSourceType.Wiki: The source of the dummy Polygon ID to use for this attack.

disableGuard.Wiki: If ON, then this attack ignores the victim's guard and applies the damage animation automatically.

disableStaminaAttack.Wiki: If ON, then this attack will not reduce the victim's stamina as a result of them guarding the attack.

disableHitSpEffect.Wiki: If ON, then this attack will not apply on-hit SpEffects to the victim.

IgnoreNotifyMissSwingForAI.Wiki: If ON, then the enemy AI is not given notification of a missed attack.

repeatHitSfx.Wiki: If ON, does the on-hit SFX for this attack repeat forever upon collision.

isArrowAtk.Wiki: If ON, then this attack will count as damage to a destructable enemy part.

isGhostAtk.Wiki: If ON, then this attack will count as damage to a ghost enemy.

isDisableNoDamage.Wiki: If ON, then invulnerability frames (such as roll frames) are ignored by this attack. Complete invulnerability is NOT ignored however.

hideHitFe.Wiki: When hit, HUD will not display Hit or Guard, so only special effects will be applied.

isDisableDmgLvReplaceAddLv.AltName: Disable Addition Replacement during Continuous Damage
isDisableDmgLvReplaceAddLv.Wiki: Do you want to disable the function that replaces the damage with additional damage when receiving continuous damage?

isDamageReactionCancelInertia.AltName: Is Inertia removed by Damage Reaction
isDamageReactionCancelInertia.Wiki: Can you eliminate inertia with damage reactions?

isCheckDoorPenetration.Wiki: Whether to perform occlusion checks. If it is ○, it will be determined whether it is possible to attack the target through the shield.

atkBehaviorId.Wiki: Behavior identification value: Causes a specific enemy to have a special reaction when hit by a specific attack.

rigidImpulse.Wiki: Impulse applied to the rigid body hit by the attack

AppearAiSoundId.Wiki: ID of AI sound generated when an attack occurs

HitAiSoundId.Wiki: ID of AI sound generated at the time of hit

HitRumbleId.Wiki: Vibration ID on hit (-1 disabled). This is the vibration ID when none of the following three apply.

HitRumbleIdByNormal.AltName: Vibration on Hit: Dummy Polygon Tip
HitRumbleIdByNormal.Wiki: Hit vibration ID when hitting the tip of the dummy polygon (-1 disabled)

HitRumbleIdByMiddle.AltName: Vibration on Hit: Dummy Polygon Center
HitRumbleIdByMiddle.Wiki: Hit vibration ID when hitting the center of the dummy polygon (-1 disabled)

HitRumbleIdByRoot.AltName: Vibration on Hit: Dummy Polygon Root
HitRumbleIdByRoot.Wiki: Hit vibration ID when hitting the root of the dummy polygon (-1 disabled)

traceSfxId0.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead0.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail0.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId1.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead1.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail0.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId2.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead0.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail0.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail3.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId4.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead4.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail4.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId5.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead5.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail5.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId6.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead6.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail6.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceSfxId7.Wiki: Particle to display for the attack trail (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdHead7.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the root of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

traceDmyIdTail7.Wiki: The dummy polygon that points to the tip of the attack trail capsule (-1 invalid)

hit4_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Dummy Polygon in sphere, capsule position

hit4_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The position of another point on the capsule Dummy Polygon. -1 makes it a sphere

hit5_DmyPoly1.Wiki: Dummy Polygon in sphere, capsule position

hit5_DmyPoly2.Wiki: The position of another point on the capsule Dummy Polygon. -1 makes it a sphere

hti4_Priority.Wiki: Hit priority. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti5_Priority.Wiki: Hit priority. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti6_Priority.Wiki: Hit priority. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

hti7_Priority.Wiki: Hit priority. If there are two or more hits at the same time, the one with the higher priority will be adopted.

bEnableSaBreak.Wiki: Is it possible to break poise?

assetBreakActionType.Wiki: TAE action type played when an asset is destroyed by this attack

cameraRumbleID.Wiki: ID of camera vibration upon hit

cameraRumbleDefenseID.Wiki: ID of camera vibration upon guarded hit

dmgHitRecordLifeTime.Wiki: The interval at which damage is taken. It only hits once at 0.0f or less.

knockbackAtkSpdScaleMinSpeedKmh.AltName: Knockback: Attacker Speed Correction - Minimum Speed
knockbackAtkSpdScaleMinSpeedKmh.Wiki: Minimum speed to determine the magnification that increases the speed of the person attacking with knockback. In kilometres per hour.

knockbackAtkSpdScaleMaxSpeedKmh.AltName: Knockback: Attacker Speed Correction - Maximum Speed
knockbackAtkSpdScaleMaxSpeedKmh.Wiki: Maximum speed to determine the magnification that increases the speed of the person attacking with knockback. In kilometres per hour.

knockbackAtkSpdScaleMinScale.AltName: Knockback: Attacker Speed Correction - Minimum Speed Multiplier
knockbackAtkSpdScaleMinScale.Wiki: Multiplier to increase the speed of the person attacking with knockback (this multiplier when the speed is below the minimum speed)

knockbackAtkSpdScaleMaxScale.AltName: Knockback: Attacker Speed Correction - Maximum Speed Multiplier
knockbackAtkSpdScaleMaxScale.Wiki: Multiplier to increase the speed of the person attacking with knockback (this multiplier when the speed is below the maximum speed)

shooterKnockbackMPS.Wiki: Recoil (knockback) speed received when shooting. In metres per second.

deadAnimType.Wiki: Determines the opponent's animation when the opponent dies from this attack.

cameraRumbleMapID.AltName: Camera Vibration ID on Map Collision
cameraRumbleMapID.Wiki: ID of camera vibration when hitting the map

cameraRumbleMapEnableDistance.Wiki: Distance at which camera vibration is effective when hitting the map. In metres.

shooterKnockbackDirType.Wiki: Direction that serves as a basis for calculating recoil knockback

dmgLevel_Friendly.Wiki: Damage level when hit by an ally including yourself

atkDarkCorrection.Wiki: Player only. Multiplier to the base Dark attack power

grabEnableDmgLevel.Wiki: You can grab it if it is above this damage level.

guardJudgeType.Wiki: Attack position type used when determining guard/barrier

hit0_Length.Wiki: Starting length of the hit capsule, in metres.

hit0_MaxLength.Wiki: Maxmimum length of the hit capsule, in metres.

hit0_LengthExpandTime.Wiki: Stretch the length in the direction of secondary dummy poly for this amount of time. In seconds.

hit0_MaxRadius.Wiki: Maxmimum radius of the hit capsule, in metres.

hit0_ThicknessExpandTime.Wiki: The thickness of the area increases linearly from the radius to the maximum radius over this time.

hit0_KeepInitTime.Wiki: Change the shape of the area after this amount of time has passed. In seconds.

hit0_SfxId.Wiki: The SFX ID used by this hit capsule.

hit0_SfxDeleteType.Wiki: The deletion type for the SFX used by this hit capsule.

hit0_hitCreateType.Wiki: The creation type used by this hit capsule.

isHitFpsBarrier.Wiki: Will it hit the FPS barrier?

isHit0_ExpandPenetrateChr.Wiki: Will it penetrate the character when expanding or contracting?

isHit0_ExpandPenetrateMap.Wiki: Will it pass through map hits when expanding or contracting?

isHit0_ExpandSfxHitPos.AltName: Hit 0: Place Particle on Hit Location
isHit0_ExpandSfxHitPos.Wiki: Should the SFX during expansion and contraction be based on the hit location?

isUseknockbackBladeAddDmg.AltName: Use Additional Knockback Power for Blade
isUseknockbackBladeAddDmg.Wiki: Should the additional damage knockback power for the blade be used

isHitSfxPosCorrection.AltName: Correct Hit Particle Position of Melee Weapon
isHitSfxPosCorrection.Wiki: Should the hit SFX generation position be corrected to the position between the lock dummy polys?

isUseHitSfxHitVel.AltName: Correct Hit Particle Direction to Bullet Direction
isUseHitSfxHitVel.Wiki: Should the hit SFX be issued according to the direction of bullet flight?

isAtkTotalWeightCorrectionRate_forPc.AltName: Is Attack Power based on Total Weight (Player Only)
isAtkTotalWeightCorrectionRate_forPc.Wiki: If 1, refer to the correction calculation graph parameter 'Total weight correction coefficient: attack power multiplier'

isChrAttachGeomSkip.Wiki: As a performance measure, do you want to avoid hitting assets attached to characters when expanding or contracting?

isInsFirstHitCheckOnly.Wiki: To improve performance, avoid checking multiple hits on the same character or asset, and be careful as the SFX generation position may shift (multiple hits are excluded after they hit, but this is excluded before they hit)

isFSDP.Wiki: Use FSDP (clog occurs when packet loss occurs instead of guaranteeing delivery)

isDisableSpEffectNoDead.Wiki: Ignore immortality special effects such as emergency PA

isMultiHitDisableMap.Wiki: Exclude the map with multiple hits?

isDefMaterialIgnore.Wiki: Do you want to disable the SFX defense material change on the impact side?

isDisableBulletGeneration.Wiki: Should multi-hit information be shared while ignoring generations when the attack ID is the same?

combatIncreasePoint.Wiki: The amount of engagement level that increases each time you are hit. Linked to AI detection

shootSeCategory.Wiki: ID for identifying SE to be played by association with attack material and attack strength

id_forSe.Wiki: Identification ID for determining the SE to play

se_reflectLv.Wiki: The level of reverb for the sound

dmgCalcSide.Wiki: Damage Judgment Side: Which side decides the hit judgment of the attack?

shooterKnockbackMoveTimeSec.Wiki: The time it takes to start slowing down due to the recoil (knockback) you receive when shooting. In seconds.

shooterKnockbackBrakeTimeSec.Wiki: The time from when you start decelerating due to the recoil (knockback) you receive when shooting until you stop. In seconds.

shooterKnockbackDecayRate.Wiki: Deceleration speed curve coefficient due to the recoil (knockback) received when shooting (the larger the value, the stronger the brake will be at the end)

shooterFlyKnockbackMPS.Wiki: Recoil (knockback) speed received when shooting. In metres per second.

shooterFlyKnockbackMoveTimeSec.Wiki: The time it takes to start slowing down due to the recoil (knockback) you receive when shooting. In seconds.

shooterFlyKnockbackBrakeTimeSec.Wiki: The time from when you start decelerating due to the recoil (knockback) you receive when shooting until you stop. In seconds.

shooterFlyKnockbackDecayRate.AltName: Aerial Recoil Knockback: Deceleration Decay Curve
shooterFlyKnockbackDecayRate.Wiki: Deceleration speed curve coefficient due to the recoil (knockback) received when shooting (the larger the value, the stronger the brake will be at the end)

statusAilmentAtkPowerCorrectRate.Wiki: Multiplying the special effect's status abnormality attack power.

statusAilmentAtkPowerCorrectRate_byPoint.Wiki: A multiplier correction will be applied to the special effect 'Do you apply the abnormal status attack power multiplier correction?'

spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byPoint.AltName: Attack Correction: SpEffect Attack Power (by Point)
spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byPoint.Wiki: A multiplier correction is applied to the attack power [point] of the special effect.

spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byRate.AltName: Attack Correction: SpEffect Attack Power (by Rate)
spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byRate.Wiki: Multiplier correction is applied to the attack power multiplier of special effects.

spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byDmg.AltName: Attack Correction: SpEffect Attack Power (by Damage)
spEffectAtkPowerCorrectRate_byDmg.Wiki: Attacker side of special effects: Performs multiplier correction for damage multiplier.

atkPa.Wiki: The base Pulse Armor attack power.

damageLevelConvId.Wiki: ID of damage level conversion parameter

damageLevelConvId_Friend.Wiki: ID of damage level conversion parameter

bBodyTrunkBreakEnable.Wiki: Can you do a core break?

addDamageAnimType.Wiki: Additive damage animation type that the opponent regenerates

addEndPermanentStunValue.AltName: Add End Permanent Stun Value (by Point)

paPenetrationPower.Wiki: Weapon para/NPC para: Used in conjunction with PA output to calculate PA cut rate.

hit15_Fan_InternalAngle.Wiki: Fan shape determination Attack Range Angle. In degrees.

brokenPartsBlowAwayAngleVertical.Wiki: The reference direction changes depending on the setting of 'Blow-off direction correction type at the time of damage', and the horizontal direction is 0.

brokenPartsBlowAwayAngleHorizontal.Wiki: The reference direction changes depending on the setting of 'Blow-off direction correction type at the time of damage'

brokenPartsBlowAwayForce.Wiki: In kilograms x metres per second

brokenPartsRotationAxisAngleVertical.Wiki: Regarding the tilt of the rotation axis, always calculate it based on the master direction of the target (Y direction in world space) without making any corrections based on the position of the bullet, and the Y direction is 0. In degrees.

brokenPartsRotationAxisAngleHorizontal.Wiki: Regarding the tilt of the rotation axis, always calculate it based on the master direction of the victim (Y direction in world space), without making any corrections based on the position of the victim.

brokenPartsRotationForce.Wiki: In kilograms x degrees per second

partsBreakLotteryId.Wiki: The damage lot to roll upon part destruction.

brokenPartsBlowAwayDirectionCompensation.Wiki: Correction type applied to the blow-off direction.

knockbackDirAngAxisX.Wiki: Correction angle used in knockback direction correction type. In degrees.

knockbackDirAngAxisY.Wiki: Correction angle used in knockback direction correction type. In degrees.

brokenPartsKnockbackRate.Wiki: Applied speed multiplier due to knockback when damaged parts are blown away.

multiHit_MaxCountBehavior.Wiki: Behavior when the number of multi-hit hits is at the upper limit

multiHit_MaxCount.Wiki: Upper limit of number of multi-hits

multiHit_ShareId.Wiki: Shared ID for multi-stage hit count

multiHit_ResetTimeSec.Wiki: Time to reset multi-hit count. In seconds.
